text: Matt Artus and Handy Chevrolet were great to deal with. Matt followed up by e-mail and phone and set up an appointment for us to look at a Chevy Tahoe we found on their website. He explained everything very clear. He was knowledgeable on the vehicles and process. He, Jason Rodrigues, and Jim Lash made this big purchase a rather smooth process. They went the extra mile so we had no worries for 7 years, bumper to bumper coverage and 0%. They saved us $7000.00. I would not hesitate for anyone  to speak to Matt and purchase a vehicle at Handy Chevrolet.

text: The East Poultney General Store is an institution in the area.  It's been around forever, but it's never been staffed by someone as friendly as the current owner, Carol.  She is always upbeat, helpful and friendly.  Her breakfast sandwiches are stellar, her  freezer is filled with good seafood and local ice cream + meat, and her VT beer selection is constantly expanding.  It's a bit busy in the mornings and around lunch, so call ahead with an order, if ya can.  Step back in time and check it out!

text: If I could give zero stars, I would. I showed up today to pick up my pre-booked standard-sized car. A compact car and a minivan were the only vehicles available. I chose the compact car and the minute I got onto the interstate, I noticed loud noises coming from the tires. I was able to safely exit the interstate and pull over in a business parking lot. I found not one,  but two severely damaged tires (one with a large bubble, about to burst, and another with several pieces of rubber missing). I had to wait for more than an hour for a tow truck and then return to the airport with the car.  Overall, the process took 2 hours of my time, just to start from square one again at the airport. There was another customer ahead of me complaining that the car they just rented had car seats in the back still and was filled  with trash. The systems are clearly failing at the Budget rental car facility at the airport. This is the last time they will have my business.

business.name: Budget Car Rental
business.address: Budget Car Rental, 1200 Airport Dr, South Burlington, VT 05403

text:
Nice little liquor store, located in a strip mall.

I only made a quick stop here, but I was impressed by how many local/New England brews they had here.

There are also ATM and lotto machines at the front of the store.

The only negative, prices were a bit on the high side.

text: Stop there for lunch before going up the road to Ben & Jerry’s.  ;) We were driving through on a nasty winter day and stopped for lunch. My Turkey Club was delicious! business.description: Seafood restaurant with indoor & outdoor seating on a floating dock with scenic lake views.

text: Not my home cooking, but we'll cooked food, healthy portions, friendly waitress, normal prices.

business.name: Cody's Cafe
business.address: Cody's Cafe, 9 Grand Ave, Swanton, VT 05488

text: Been coming here for a long time. It never disappoints. Service is great. Way more authentic here than those take out places. I see some not so good reviews on here. I don't get it. This place is great.

business.name: A Single Pebble
business.address: A Single Pebble, 133 Bank St, Burlington, VT 05401
business.description: Welcoming spot serving Chinese specialties (including many meatless options) family-style.

text: Best pizza around, and an amazing beer selection!

business.name: Vermont Tap House
business.address: Vermont Tap House, 22 Merchants Row, Williston, VT 05495
business.description: Wood-fired pizza, sandwiches & local beer served in a relaxed setting with traditional decor.

text: Needs a lot of work. Has gone down hill fast. Not reliable for appts and being on time

business.name: Green Mountain Express
business.address: Green Mountain Express, 215 Pleasant St, Bennington, VT 05201

text: We stopped in here while visiting the lovely town and covered bridge of Waitsfield, VT during our fall foliage trip through New England.  Our tummy's told us it was time to eat and we devoured our delicious turkey and cheese and rye. The help was friendly and quick. Nice tables to sit and eat inside. Kid and disability friendly with restrooms on site. Kindly click the like button if this review or my photos are useful.

business.name: Three Mountain Cafe
business.address: Three Mountain Cafe, 107 Mad River Green, Waitsfield, VT 05673

text: Very cute. Great place for gifts.

text: What you would expect out of most Irving Gas Stations but this one is particularly large

text: Fantastic pub at the base of Burke Mountain! A must go to if you are in town!

text: Terrible food, at least the service was good. Can't blame the servers.

business.name: St Albans Diner
business.address: St Albans Diner, 8 Swanton Rd, St Albans City, VT 05478

text: This is hands down the best restaurant in Vermont.  There are always interesting specials, that are fresh and delicious.  Don't miss out on this if you are in Waterbury or the area.

business.name: The Reservoir
business.address: The Reservoir, 1 S Main St, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676
business.description: Down-to-earth spot offering 30+ beers on tap, comfort food & weekly live-music shows.

text: Friendly attendants, cheap lift tickets at night. Not worth it during the day.

business.name: Bolton Valley Resort
business.address: Bolton Valley Resort, 4302 Bolton Access Rd, Richmond, VT 05477
business.description: Slopeside resort featuring low-key rooms & condos, a ski shop, pool & several dining options.

text: I took my daughter there for her first concert, Jason Darulo! The food amazing, cause I love fair food. We didn't do any rides but had a great time at the concert. Well worth the 2 HR drive from home

business.name: Champlain Valley Exposition
business.address: Champlain Valley Exposition, 3625, 105 Pearl St, Essex Junction, VT 05452

text: Always enjoy our meal and time here.

business.name: Ladder 1 Grill
business.address: Ladder 1 Grill, 8 S Main St, Barre, VT 05641
business.description: Chops, burgers & other American basics are served at this homey venue located in a former firehouse.

text: The food was...meh, at best.  Beef was too fatty, and not in the good way.  Also, don't trust the online order system, they may not notify you when it's actually ready.

business.name: Big Fatty's BBQ
business.address: Big Fatty's BBQ, 186 S Main St, White River Junction, VT 05001
business.description: Seasoned meats, burgers & sandwiches are served at this unfussy BBQ spot with weekly live bands.

text: Amazing landscape. Truly an amazing place!

text: Nice property and good food

text: the men's room stinks like an opened sewer. but the hard working staff is awesome!

business.name: Higher Ground
business.address: Higher Ground, 1214 Williston Rd, South Burlington, VT 05403
business.description: All-ages venue with 3 bars, staging national & local music acts plus DJ nights.

text: Super friendly staff. Great skiing.

business.name: Smugglers' Notch Resort
business.address: Smugglers' Notch Resort, 4323 VT-108, Jeffersonville, VT 05464
business.description: Modern condo units in a scenic mountain setting with casual dining & year-round activities.

text:
This icon of Burlington has seen better days. Yes, Wuhan virus adaptive measures by the state have caused a lot of challenges. But more to my point is that I felt like I was in a protest parade and that every shop was a posterboard for multiple causes.

A word to Merchants: sometimes people just want to shop, not be involuntarily exposed to something they may have already paid a lot of attention to. Many of us just do it because, not because of a sad poster in your window.

I noticed on a few occasions that the strong odor of pot would suddenly make its presence known to my nostrils on turning a corner. During mid-day. But hey, it's legal here so deal with it. That and the skateboarding mid-30's adult who cut between the dining tables where you may be sitting and trying to eat.

No thanks Burlington, we won't miss each other in the future.

business.name: Church Street Marketplace
business.address: Church Street Marketplace, 2 Church St Suite 2A, Burlington, VT 05401
business.description: Local shops, eateries & entertainment in an outdoor pedestrian mall with historic architecture.

text: It's fine if you want good food and drink, expensive outdoor clothing, and boutique women's wear. For everything else, go to South Burlington or Williston.

business.name: Church Street Marketplace
business.address: Church Street Marketplace, 2 Church St Suite 2A, Burlington, VT 05401
business.description: Local shops, eateries & entertainment in an outdoor pedestrian mall with historic architecture.

text: Great place with a variety of shops and restaurants! A few homeless people begging for money, but normally they don't bother you.

business.name: Church Street Marketplace
business.address: Church Street Marketplace, 2 Church St Suite 2A, Burlington, VT 05401
business.description: Local shops, eateries & entertainment in an outdoor pedestrian mall with historic architecture.

text: One of the best visitors centers ever. Stop there every time we pass by.
